Fully agree with the Tank Assassin problem, and wish riot would work a little faster on that problem.  Up-vote for that.

BUT...  Everyone complained not stop about SoloQ when it was here, and now that its more Dynamic, everyone complains its not here...  Give Riot a break already.  
  
Dynamic queue is exactly what people have been asking for, for years.  If you do not what to play ranked since your team will have a chance of being more coordinated(as a 4-man-premade-team) then before, then don't.  This has no downfall to your queue since after about 400 ranked games, most players are withing 1-2 divisions of me almost every game, meaning I would have a good chance to queue with them EVEN IN SoloQ.  PLUS having a whole other queue will increase queue times to more then 10m.  I have yet to see one person give a good reason as to why SoloQ should be a thing again, but there are LOTS or reasons why it should not.

I think the first one is covered in the second paragraph of the Items section. They only specifically mention Graves as an example, but I think they're referring to anyone that unconventionally builds  juggernaut (like Akali, Yasuo, Fiora, Master Yi, etc) who can go like Titanic, one other dmg/def item, then a bunch of defense and still do obscene amounts of dmg without being a juggernaut by nature (like Darius, Garen, Illaoi, etc)

NB4 people like Rengar who can/should have the option to build more healthy/tanky and still do good damage (Cause they're fighters/assassins) get that attention too. Though, i have to say, fighting a tanky Yi who can essentially decimate a team with little to no skill is something i highly hate.

Well I feel like that would give AP champions too many defensive options, as they already have Zhonyas which is a very powerful defensive item. Building Zhonya and an AP equivalent of QSS on an ap champ seems like a very unhealthy combo for game balance.

Zhonya's Hourglass and Abyssal Scepter are literally their only noteworthy items that give split stats, and Hourglass is a mage's _only_ means of dealing with AD. They don't really have many options as it is.

I am profoundly disappointed that the word "vision" didn't even show up in this post.  The vision game is much less interesting than it was before this season, with much less play and counterplay involved for all players.  This has contributed a lot to the game health issues.  And whereas in previous seasons, the trinkets were tweaked virtually every patch to make sure that core game component was as good as it could be and constantly improving, this season it's just been left to rot.
Thank God they are finally waking up and buffing Turrets.

First post ever, because I feel strongly about this, don't touch velkoz or syndra please. They are both good where they are at.

Syndra is absolutely awful right now. She is one of the worst mages in the entire game against tanks. She is also one of the most mana hungry, with a somewhat subpar range, and her burst is surprisingly low. She relies on her base damages, but her base damages are so law its fairly embarrasing to hit an enemy with a Q for them to outdate you with just an auto. There is literally no reason to pick Syndra over Annie other than a few more units of range while being far less threatening.
As much as I LOVE Syndra, I have to agree :/

Because Tanks are overpowered right now. Tanks that also do damage? that's stupid. If they are gonna do nuke damage then mages should be able to nuke them down faster, or whats the point of a burst mage?

The MYMU is not about correcting flaws or 'fixing champions". The roster changes are designed to make each member of the class feel unique and distinct to play. When I think of what a burst mage should be, I think of Annie or perhaps Leblanc. Annie is a fairly binary character who's unique ability/playstyle is centered in Tibbers. However, Tibbers doesnt feel impactful after that initial summon. Riot is looking to make Tibbers more frightening post-summon to highlight that iconic interaction. Syndra on the other hand is super unique. However, syndra doesnt see play becasue of her low ratios. Riot has her balanced this way because she is too good at evrything. When you have single or multitarget cc and tons of damage, somethings got to give. Riot has stated that they want to focus on the fantasy of her balls becoming more menacing over the course of the game. Hope this helps.
